meanings.sent1: She kept misstarting the car by turning the key too quickly.
meanings.sent2: He tends to misstart his sentences when he is nervous.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked about misstarting his morning by putting salt instead of sugar in his coffee.
meanings.sent4: Her misstarting the race put her at a disadvantage from the beginning.
meanings.sent5: The student's habit of misstarting his homework assignments led to many mistakes.

meanings.definition: The act of starting something incorrectly.
meanings.sent1: The misstarting of the project caused delays in the schedule.
meanings.sent2: His constant misstarting of conversations made him seem unsure.
meanings.sent3: The misstarting of the play brought laughter from the audience.
meanings.sent4: The misstarting of the engine was a sign of the car's age.
meanings.sent5: The misstarting of the meeting led to confusion among the participants.
